definition: clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: And who wants it tamed anyway?
sentences.chinese: 再說又有誰想馴服它呢？

sentences.english: Only recently has Russia tamed Chechnya.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯最近才馴服車臣。

sentences.english: Green kept 10 tame dingoes in separate laboratory pens.
sentences.chinese: 格林把十隻馴服了的野狗養在隔離的實驗圍欄裏。

sentences.english: The llama was domesticated long ago as a beast of burden.
sentences.chinese: 很早以前，美洲駱駝就被馴服爲役獸。

sentences.english: Docile, it accepts the reiterated suggestion.
sentences.chinese: 馴服的公衆接受了這個一再被重申的啓事。

sentences.english: We experienced great difficulty in taming tigers.
sentences.chinese: 我們在馴服老虎的過程中歷盡艱辛。

sentences.english: The Razorfang Ravager can now be tamed.
sentences.chinese: 剃牙掠奪者現在可以被馴服。

sentences.english: We are trying to tame a really mad horse.
sentences.chinese: 我們正設法馴服一匹發了瘋的馬。

sentences.english: Feral: existing in a wild or untamed state.
sentences.chinese: 野性的，處於一種野性或未馴服的狀態。

sentences.english: I just feels like there's this effort of taming nature.
sentences.chinese: 我只是感到人們在努力馴服自然。

sentences.english: Nutrition experts offer these simple tips to tame your urges.
sentences.chinese: 營養學家給你一些關於馴服自己渴望的小竅門。

sentences.english: These are real beasts and it's impossible to totally tame them.
sentences.chinese: 這些是真正的野獸，它不可能完全馴服它們。

sentences.english: One only understands the things that one tames.
sentences.chinese: 只有被馴服了的事情，纔會被瞭解。

sentences.english: One only understands the things that one tames .
sentences.chinese: 無論是誰，都只理解被他馴服的東西。

sentences.english: Tamed Drywallow Snappers now will know Bite 5 (instead of Claw 5.
sentences.chinese: 被馴服的塵泥鉗嘴鱷魚將會習得撕咬5，而非爪擊5。

definition: to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
to sever all relations with sb/determined/decisive
to endure humiliation as part of an important mission (idiom); to suffer in silence
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to have tender affection for/to love tenderly/to pamper sb
to do what one is told/obedient
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
